channel.title: Server version?
channel.description: I have the paid version of course and can't connect. Is the server still running 1.1 or has it since upgraded? I get a read time out error.

item.title: Server version?
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

[quote=“Spankr Poodle, post:9, topic:438629”][quote author=hat trix link=topic=541337.msg3965747#msg3965747 date=1333692910]

If the sticky still says 1.1, then we are still running 1.1.

Is there an legal way to downgrade?

Would it even be “illegal”? just my guess from the question you asked but, you bought the game. who is to say that “you just never force updated”. just do it bro, no harm involved.
[/quote]

It’s illegal to upload minecraft jars since they are copyrighted by Mojang.[/quote]

aah. thats kinda lame though because its not only the pirated versions of the game that would need the jar
and its not like its being sold. mojang should host a library of older jars themselves for access to players who have payed for the game imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Server version?

item.description:

If the sticky still says 1.1, then we are still running 1.1.

Is there an legal way to downgrade?
[/quote]

Would it even be “illegal”? just my guess from the question you asked but, you bought the game. who is to say that “you just never force updated”. just do it bro, no harm involved.[/quote]

It’s illegal to upload minecraft jars since they are copyrighted by Mojang.

@Travas wrote:

MediaFire

minecraft.jar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.
